page.title: 01PLAIN OF THE CONGRESBURY YEO
page.content: The parishes of WIck St.Lawrence and Kingston Seymour, which are part of the Woodspring District of the County of Avon, are separated by the Congresbury Yeo river which flows from the south west to the Bristol Channel. The whole area is in places below sea level,flat and given over to farming. As the Congresbury Yeo cannot be crossed for a considerable way inland there is no contact between the two villages although in character they are very similar. Wick St. Lawrence has a population of 200 and is reached from the main Bristol to Weston Super Mare road at Hewish.It is about two miles from Weston Super Mare as the crow flies but much further by road. Kingston Seymour is three miles from Clevedon and is just off the Clevedon to Yatton road.The population is 360 .
